note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: PBO Repo
tagline: A repository for metadata, flatfiles, etc. regarding Plate Boundary Observatory (PBO) stations and data products.
body:
What is this project?
================
This is a self-maintained repository for any type of meta information for Plate Boundary Observatory (PBO) stations I find useful for my own research.  Feel free to contact me (@abarbour) should you wish to see other data included.  More information may be found on the [PBO website](http://pbo.unavco.org/).

This website is organized by the section headings, with links to the @github "blobs" for each dataset; from there you can access the raw data should you need to.  The section at the end of the page ([NEWS](http://abarbour.github.com/pborepo#NEWS)) lists brief descriptions of any changes or significant updates.

PBO borehole strainmeters (BSM)
-------------------------------

[`bsm_azimuths`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/bsm_azimuths)
* Orientations of the individual BSM channels **Note: if Ch0==0 then it is an assumed value (and likely not correct)**

[`bsm_coords`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/bsm_coords)
* Coordinates of BSM stations, from the latest listing.

[`bsm_gaps`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/bsm_geps)
* By station: capacitance-bridge gap separations, install/lin. dates; these are generally used for strain data linearization.

[`bsm_igppGeod`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/bsm_igppGeod)
* Geodetics from my office to the PBO BSM sites.

[`bsm_regions`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/bsm_regions)
* Regional classifications; these are found in the long (16-character) station names.

PBO longbase laser strainmeters (LSM)
-------------------------------------

[`lsm_coords`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/lsm_coords)
* Coordinates and counts-to-strain scalings for LSM sites, including inactive
`YMS`, and non-PBO sites: `PFO[123]` and `DHL1`.

PBO continuous Global Positioning System (GPS) stations
-------------------------------------------------------

[`cgps_coords`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/cgps_coords)
* coordinates of continuous gps sites, from latest listing

PBO borehole network
--------------------

[`pbo_stations_raw`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_raw)
* This is a raw listing of PBO stations, from NCEDC/IRIS-DMC; the values are comma-separated and some fields have character strings in quotations.

**Note: the following are derived from the raw listing:**

[`pbo_stations_instrumentcount`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_instrumentcount)
* Counts of the various instrument types in the network.

[`pbo_stations_accel`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_accel)
* List of stations having strong motion accelerometers.

[`pbo_stations_bsm`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_bsm)
* List of stations having borehole strainmeters.

[`pbo_stations_lsm`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_lsm)
* List of stations having laser strainmeters.

[`pbo_stations_pp`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_pp)
* List of stations having pore pressure sensors.

[`pbo_stations_seis`](https://github.com/abarbour/pborepo/blob/master/pbo_stations_seis)
* List of stations having seismometers (geophones).

NEWS
====
* January 2013 (website branch added)
